runway closed after plane has landing problems .
spending on agency staff doubles at royal cornwall hospital .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on wednesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: meet theresa , who called barnstable , usa ; not barnstaple , devon
text: theresa thought she 'd called police in barnstaple , devon .
she was through to barnstable , massachusetts .
she 's on @ twitterid and @ twitterid
was very funny x
i 'm staggered she managed to do this .
i mean dialling 101 ca n't be that difficult surely

documents.title: dartmoor settlement launches legal challenge against dismantling order
text: residents of an `` eco '' settlement on dartmoor have launched a legal challenge against a planning decision forcing them to dismantle their homes .
the steward community has been living on the site near moretonhampstead for about 16 years but have now been given until next august to move out .
planners at the national park authority have rejected permanent permission because they said the community has a harmful impact .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: dumping of an unwell dog condemned as 'heartless '
text: the dumping of an unwell dog in exeter has been condemned by the rspca as `` heartless '' .
inspectors said they were investigating after the animal was left tied up outside the one stop shop on topsham road on 4 september .
the staffie/shar pei cross was found in `` desperate '' need of veterinary care with a skin condition and ear infection .
it has since received treatment .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: latest headlines in devon and cornwall
text: latest headlines in devon and cornwall
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: latest weather : clear spells overnight and a brighter wednesday
text: there 'll be clear spells at times overnight , allowing the temperature to fall , leading to the occasional mist or fog patch developing , especially over high ground such as exmoor .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
any mist or fog will clear on wednesday to leave a brighter day , with spells of sunshine and perhaps an isolated shower for some too .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: David Braine
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: latest travel updates in devon
text: latest travel updates in devon
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: mitie profits warning : analysis
text: shares in outsourcing group mitie , which , among other ventures , provides catering and cleaning services for the royal cornwall hospitals trust - have sunk by a quarter after it cut its profit outlook amid uncertainty over the uk 's decision to leave the eu and other `` economic pressures '' .
the city exacts a heavy price from companies whose profits do n't live up to expectations .
even by the city 's harsh standards , today 's plunge was spectacular .

the value of mitie fell by a quarter because the reasons it gave were not flash-in-the-pan problems , but significant economic pressures which highlight trends of interest to a wider group than the outsourcing company 's shareholders .
mitie said profits will be hit by a triple whammy of a higher minimum wage , declining local authority budgets and brexit concerns .
mitie also provides social care and housing maintenance services to local councils , and the company said it was feeling the effects of cuts to their budgets .
mitie is in many ways a microcosm of some of the big issues facing uk businesses - and as the city reminded it today , not in a good way .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: gran fends off thief who tried to climb through bedroom window
text: a disabled grandmother fended off a hooded thief who tried to climb through her bedroom window while she lay in bed this morning .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: royal cornwall hospitals trust needs a 'planned approach '
text: the chief executive of the royal cornwall hospitals trust says the health organisation needs to change its approach to dealing with its finances and other aspects of its work .
the trust spent nearly £ 13m on agency staff last year , up from £ 7.5m spent the year before , a freedom of information request has revealed .
chief executive kathy byrne said she expected to see a fall in the amount spent on temporary staff .
she also told bbc radio cornwall : `` we need to shift the system from being reactive and disjointed to being proactive and planned in approach . ''
she also said she wanted staff to be `` valued , happy , confident of their futures and proud of the service they provide '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: exeter 's tomas francis faces hearing tomorrow
text: exeter chiefs prop tomas francis will appear before a rugby football union disciplinary panel in bristol tomorrow night to find out if he will be banned for being sent off on saturday .
the 24-year-old wales international was red-carded for the second time in six months after kicking out at a ruck during exeter 's 36-25 win over harlequins .
chiefs head coach rob baxter has defended francis and called for more clarity in the sport 's rules .
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: tour of britain : 90 % of survey respondents 'would donate to bring race back '
text: more than 90 % of respondents to a survey currently under way say they would donate money to see the tour of britain cycle race come back to devon , the county council says .
thousands of people lined the streets of devon to see stage six of the race on 9 september .
it featured sir bradley wiggins and was won by dutchman wouter poels from team sky .
it was the ninth time it was in the county and it helped boost the local economy by £ 6m , the council said .
it added : `` however , to host the tour of britain in devon again will require funding .
one option being explored is `` crowd funding '' , where members of the public and others with an interest put money in to support the event . ''
so far , over 90 % say they 'd donate to see tob return .
would you ?
survey : # wearedevon
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: south west paralympians back from rio 2016
text: the british paralympic team are back home after finishing in second place in the rio games .
south west athletes jonathan fox and melissa reid were among the medalists touching down in heathrow , after winning a silver and bronze medal respectively .
britain finished the games with 147 medals in total , 64 of which were gold - the most won by a british team since 1988 .
the team finished second overall behind china .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: pedestrian crossing posts in middle of pavements 'since 1999 '
text: posts for pedestrian crossing buttons in the middle of pavements in hayle have been in that position since 1999 , cornwall council says .
disability cornwall said the design of the revamped crossing - with buttons placed on poles in the middle of the footpath - posed a real danger for those with visual problems .
the council said waist-high stub posts were installed `` as part of our ongoing replacement programme '' and pillars for the crossing had been in those locations since 1999 , sending an earlier .
the crossing .
however , it said it recognised the site `` no longer meets the current disability discrimination act '' and and the stub post `` was removed yesterday morning '' .
it added that it could not remove the main posts `` without removing the entire crossing '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: 'psychotic monster ' anthony martin jailed for child rape and sex assaults
text: a `` psychotic monster '' who subjected his child victim to a vicious prolonged period of rapes and sexual assaults has been jailed as more details about his twisted past came to light .
author: West Briton

documents.title: american police called to crash in devon
text: american police called to crash in devon

documents.title: cutting agency spending in hospitals 'is important '
text: reducing the use of agency staff in hospitals in cornwall `` is important '' , the head of the royal cornwall hospitals trust has acknowledged .
the trust spent nearly £ 13m on agency staff last year , up from £ 7.5m spent the year before .

trust chief executive kathy byrne , said : `` reducing the amount we spend on agency staff is important and that is why we have recently recruited over 200 substantive clinical staff and changed our approach to using agencies .
`` in august , we saw a £ 300,000 reduction in the amount spent on agency staff and we expect to see a further fall in september .
patient safety is always the top priority in deciding any additional spending . ''
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: padbrook park to close its golf course after 'decline in industry '
text: well known mid devon golf course padbrook park will close down .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: nhs dentist waiting list : slight rise in patients seen
text: there 's been a big rise in the number of people on the waiting list to get an nhs dentist in parts of the south west , with some areas seeing a 300 % rise in demand in a year .
nhs england do n't contest this sharp rise in people on waiting lists - the figures come from it .
but it does say that , if you look at the number of people being seen by a dentist across cornwall in the last two years , those numbers are up - although only slightly up , from 307,000 to 310,000 .
nhs england also said extra money had been put into dental services in falmouth and helston , and its continuing to look at `` how we can increase capacity in other areas that are under pressure '' .
author: Kirk England
BBC South West

documents.title: new uni students urged to get vaccinated
text: fresher students in # plymouth urged to protect themselves against # meningitis get # menacwy vaccine .
# stopthespread

documents.title: hospitals cleaning and catering company issues profits warning
text: the company that runs cleaning and catering at cornwall 's main hospitals has issued a profits warning .
shares in outsourcing group mitie have sunk by a quarter after it cut its profit outlook amid uncertainty over the uk 's decision to leave the eu and other `` economic pressures '' .
mitie took over so-called `` hotel services '' at the royal cornwall hospitals trust ( rcht ) in 2014 as part of a £ 90m contract .
its work has been criticised since .
the trust previously said high standards were required from the company .
mitie said its profits would be `` materially below '' its expectations as a result of challenges it faced .
it also said `` uncertainty both pre and post the eu referendum '' was to blame .

documents.title: police arrest suspect in hunt for cowick street flasher
text: police are questioning a man in connection with the hunt for a flasher who has been stalking exeter 's cowick street .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

text: lovely view looking across the river plym at saltram , this morning .

documents.title: barnstaple police gaffe 'computer glitch '
text: a woman from barnstaple in devon who accidentally called police 3,000 miles away in barnstable , massachusetts , blames a computer glitch for the mix-up .
teresa saunders said `` i have n't stopped laughing '' after she ended up speaking to police in the usa after using windows 'digital assistant ' ask cortana to find the number .

documents.title: burglar targets four properties in plymouth street
text: police in plymouth are investigating a series of burglaries and attempted burglaries in one street .

officers said four properties on dawson close in the st budeaux area were targeted this morning , and items taken included ladies ' handbags , a pale pink studded bag containing a laptop , and a small trinket box with crystals in .
police are trying to trace a suspect described as `` white , of a tall height with dark hair and a beard '' .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: increasing agency bill for royal cornwall hospitals trust : analysis
text: the royal cornwall hospitals trust spent nearly £ 13m on agency staff last year , up from £ 7.5m spent the year before .
the figures from a freedom of information request come as the trust was also ranked as one of the worst acute trusts in england in a recent staff satisfaction survey .
efforts have been under way at the trust to try to recruit staff - even looking abroad for nurses .
however , both recruiting and retaining workers wo n't be helped by a recent staff satisfaction survey that put the rcht in the bottom 20 % of all acute trusts in england .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: neighbours describe 'inferno ' as torquay house goes up in flames
text: neighbours who were evacuated from houses near a raging fire in wellswood , torquay have described seeing an 'inferno ' over the rooftops .

the record was narrowly missed by 77 pirates
but now it 's emerged 14,849 people were sold wristbands on the day in 2014 .
that number would have broken the record , but some of those pirates were n't present for the 16:00 official count .

documents.title: boating lake silt 'making it unslightly '
text: an iconic lake in newquay - a recognised tourist attraction - is being described as unsightly and letting the area down as it 's silted up .
some newquay residents say they 've waited for four years for cornwall council to sort out a build up of silt at trenance boating lake .
councillor dave sleeman said it was the authority 's responsibility to sort out the problems but there seems to be several arguments over money and the cause of the problem .

the council said it was `` working with stakeholders ( including the environment agency , other council officers and contractors ) and reviewing options to identify a suitable , long-term solution . ''
author: Laurence Reed
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: lack of nhs dentists make patient feel like 'second-class citizen '
text: there 's been a sharp rise in the number of people on the waiting list to get an nhs dentist in parts of cornwall .
the restormel area has seen a 200 % increase in people who want to register in a year , with the waiting list now standing at just over 3,000 people .
in carrick , the increase is 190 % , up from 600 to 1,700 over the same period .
carradon , penwith and north cornwall have also seen increases .
pat st ledger , from redruth , needed an nhs dentist back in april and said the closest one she could find at the time was 30 miles away in st blazey .
she said her search made her feel like a `` second-class citizen '' .
waiting list has risen sharply for an nhs dentist in parts of sw. nhs england admits demand is high .
did you struggle like pat to find one ?
there is an easy way around the policing issue use retired officers on civil pay to deal with the crime investigation
i walked into first dentist in cullompton & was taken on nhs list not unusual
@ twitterid has been focused on this on behalf of @ twitterid constituents .
tories need to do more .
author: Kirk England
BBC South West

documents.title: school crossing patrol gets three-month reprieve
text: a school facing having its crossing patrol axed has had a temporary reprieve .

cornwall council has agreed for king charles primary school in falmouth to keep a patrol person on albany road for another three months after a petition by parents cited concerns about childrens ' safety .
the council announced earlier this year it was cutting 19 school patrols .

documents.title: paul tisdale expects reuben reid to offer something new to city
text: reuben reid will bring something different to exeter city 's attack , according to manager paul tisdale .
reid made his debut in saturday 's 2-0 derby defeat by his former club plymouth argyle , having joined city on 13 september after being a free agent since leaving the pilgrims in june .
`` i think he 's going to bring another dimension to us , '' tisdale said .
`` the next game or two will tell how he 'll settle into the team . ''

documents.title: royal cornwall trust agency spend doubles
text: the royal cornwall hospitals trust spent an extra £ 5m on agency staff in 2015 compared to the previous year , a freedom of information request has revealed .
the trust spent £ 13.1m on agency staff , mainly doctors and nurses , in 2015 to 2016 , compared to £ 7.5m the year before .
the foi request also showed that one agency got more than £ 1.1m from the trust in 2015 .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police manhunt to find three paignton shop raiders
text: police hunting three men who raided a shop in paignton have issued a public appeal for information .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: barnstaple , devon or barnstable , usa : what 's in a name ?
text: a devon woman who ended up reporting an alleged local traffic incident to police in america says it was because of `` digital assistant '' cortana on her computer .
theresa , from ilfracombe , said she had n't stopped laughing since a recording of the mistake went viral online .
she told bbc radio devon she meant to call police in barnstaple , devon , but the online system connected her to barnstable in massachusetts , usa .
she said : `` the telephone number just came up [ on the computer ] and my friend told me : 'just ring it ' .
next thing i know , i was talking to massachusetts . ''
the amercian call handler in massachusetts apologised that he could not help , and also pointed out that the department 's response time was `` going to be above six hours '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: elderly woman 'believed to be washing car ' when she was 'crushed by it '
text: an elderly woman has died after she was reportedly `` crushed by her own car '' while washing it , police have said .
the 79-year-old woman from east devon died in derriford hospital on saturday , two days after emergency services were called to the incident at park close , woodbury , devon .
`` it is thought that she was washing her car when it rolled forward , '' devon and cornwall police said .
no formal identification had taken place but next of kin have been informed .
author: Rachael Thorn
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest weather : mainly cloudy with some breaks
text: it is a mild and mainly cloudy day with some bright or sunny spells at times , the best of which will be in the west and south .
there is also a chance of an odd isolated shower through the day too , most likely over the moors .
winds will be light northerly .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
it will remain cloudy overnight , but with a few breaks too , where we may see some mist forming .
winds be light and variable becoming southerly later in the night .
minimum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .

documents.title: navy officer denies sexual assault at dartmouth 's royal naval college
text: a royal navy officer has pleaded not guilty to the sexual assault of a woman at a military training college .
the alleged offence is said to have taken place at the britannia royal naval college in dartmouth on july 5 last year .
a 25-year-old sub lieutenant denied the offence during a short hearing at portsmouth naval base 's court martial centre .
the sailor is due to stand trial in february .

documents.title: hayle pedestrian crossing buttons in middle of pavement
text: the man who represents disabled people in cornwall has condemned new pedestrian crossing buttons installed in hayle .
steve paget , chairman of disability cornwall , said the design of the crossing - with buttons placed on poles in the middle of the footpath - `` beggars belief `` .
he said the poles posed a real danger for those with visual problems .

documents.title: south west smoking rates fall
text: smoking rates in the south west are now at a record low , in one of the largest decreases in england .
figures released by public health england show that the number of people lighting up has fallen from 18.7 % four years ago to 15.5 % now .
experts said the fall was partly due to the availability of e-cigarettes .
author: BBC News Health

documents.title: woman , 79 , 'crushed by own car ' dies
text: a 79-year-old woman who was reportedly crushed by her own car has died in hospital , police have said .
the local woman was taken to royal devon & exeter hospital and then moved to derriford hospital in plymouth on thursday after she was injured in park close , woodbury , in east devon .
devon and cornwall police said no formal id had taken place but next of kin had been informed of her death .
author: Rachael Thorn
BBC News Online

documents.title: firefighters free children locked in bathroom
text: two children locked in a bathroom have been released by firefighters .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service said it was called to foreland view in ilfracombe at about 08:30 to the pair , who were accidentally locked in .
they were released from the bathroom using small tools .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: nhs dentist waiting list : what are the problems ?
text: there 's been a sharp rise in the number of people on the waiting list to get an nhs dentist in parts of the south west , with some areas seeing a 300 % rise in demand in a year .
but why ?
it 's complicated and what is to blame really depends on who you talk to , but several dentists in the region i 've spoken to blame two things .
firstly , contracts : dental practices have contracts with the nhs to do a certain amount of nhs work .
once that money has gone , they stop seeing nhs patients .
in very simplistic terms , the ones i 've spoken to say they would like to treat more nhs patients but that the contracts and the money they got did not allow it .
secondly , they claim there is also a shortage of dentists .
however , the department of health disagrees with that .
it said : `` there is no evidence of a national shortage of nhs dentists . ''
author: Kirk England
BBC South West

documents.title: runway closed after plane has landing problems
text: the runway at exeter airport was closed briefly yesterday evening after a plane on a test flight developed a problem with its landing gear .
emergency services were put on standby at about 19:30 after the pilot of the eastern airways aircraft issued the warning mid-flight but the plane `` landed safely '' , an airport spokesman said .
the airport was closed for 24 minutes but no inbound or outbound flights were affected .
the spokesman said the plane was being put through a service at flybe 's hangers in exeter .
the bbc has approached eastern airways for comment .
author: Rachael Thorn
BBC News Online

documents.title: chiefs boss backs luke cowan-dickie for england spot
text: exeter chiefs hooker luke cowan-dickie 's current form is worthy of a place in the england side , according to his head coach rob baxter .
cowan-dickie , 23 , has scored four tries in his past two games and has found himself vying with jamie george to be second choice behind captain dylan hartley .
`` i think he 'll give eddie jones ( the england head coach ) a few difficult selection issues with the form he 's playing with at the minute , '' baxter told bbc radio devon .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: dawlish party 'closed down ' after 10 hours
text: police officers spent 10 hours dealing with complaints about the level of noise of music coming from a private party at a house in woods near dawlish warren on friday night .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: helicopter included in military-themed stained glass window
text: a unique stained glass window de a merlin helicopter has been installed in the church at the royal citadel in plymouth .
the modern military scene was commissioned by 29 commando to mark the 300th anniversary of the royal artillery .
the artwork , at the royal chapel of st katherine upon the hoe , also celebrates the 350 year anniversary of the citadel .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: royal navy ships leave on deployment
text: plymouth-based warships hms bulwark and hms ocean - two of the royal navy 's biggest vessels - have been deployed to the middle east .
along with hundreds of royal marines , they 're part of a bigger task group aimed at providing military contingencies should they be needed .
helicopter carrier hms ocean ( on monday morning .
amphibious assault ship hms bulwark went on monday evening .

documents.title: more than £ 13m spent on agency staff by hospital trust
text: a freedom of information request has found the royal cornwall hospitals trust spent more than £ 13m employing agency staff last year .
that is double the previous year , when the trust spent £ 7.5m ; and more than the year before , when the agency bill was just under £ 6m .
south west political reporter tamsin melville said one agency alone cost the trust £ 1.1m in 2015 .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: rise in dentist waiting lists numbers
text: there 's been a sharp rise in the number of people on the waiting list to get an nhs dentist in parts of the south west .
figures show that across the devon county area the waiting list has risen from about 2,000 people in june last year to more than 6,000 in july .
numbers are also up across much of cornwall , with the restormel , carrick , carradon , penwith and north cornwall all seeing increases in demand .
in restormel alone , demand has increased by 200 % .
nhs england said more people were seeing an nhs dentist in the region , but admitted that demand was high .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for tuesday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
